term.title: residual emission anisotropy

item.text: Photoselected molecules hindered in their rotation (e.g., in lipid bilayers or liquid crystals) do not become randomly oriented even after long time periods. Thus, the emission anisotropy does not decay to zero but to a steady value, r ∞, called residual emission anisotropy. notes.item: The term residual anisotropy is to be preferred to 'limiting anisotropy'.
